syllabus: Programming Fundamentals: variables, control flow (if, switch, loops), functions, recursion, call-stack, memory layout, compilation vs interpretation, debugging techniques, version control (Git).

Object-Oriented Programming: classes & objects, encapsulation, inheritance, polymorphism (static vs dynamic), interfaces/abstract classes, SOLID principles, design patterns (Singleton, Factory, Observer, Strategy, MVC).
Data Structures: arrays, linked lists (singly, doubly, circular), stacks, queues, deques, priority queues, heaps (binary, d-ary), hash tables (chaining, open addressing), bloom filters, skip lists.

Algorithms: asymptotic notation (Big-O, Omega, Theta), master theorem, divide-and-conquer, greedy, dynamic programming, graph algorithms (BFS, DFS, Dijkstra, A*, Bellman-Ford, Floyd-Warshall, MST-Kruskal/Prim), topological sort, max-flow (Ford-Fulkerson), string matching (KMP, Rabin-Karp), NP-completeness & reductions.

Advanced Algorithms: segment trees, Fenwick trees, suffix arrays/trees, computational geometry (convex hull, line-sweep), matrix exponentiation, number-theoretic algorithms (GCD, modular inverse, Chinese remainder, fast exponentiation), probabilistic & approximation algorithms.

Discrete Mathematics: propositional & predicate logic, proofs (induction, contradiction, contraposition), sets, relations, functions, combinatorics, counting, pigeonhole principle, inclusion-exclusion, generating functions, recurrence relations, graph theory (isomorphism, coloring, planarity, matchings).

Linear Algebra & Numerical Methods: vectors, matrices, determinants, eigenvalues/eigenvectors, LU/QR/SVD decomposition, solving linear systems, least squares, numerical integration, root-finding (Newton-Raphson, bisection), floating-point precision issues.

Probability & Statistics: random variables, distributions (binomial, Poisson, normal), Bayes’ theorem, expectation, variance, covariance, central limit theorem, hypothesis testing, confidence intervals, p-value, regression (linear, logistic), maximum likelihood estimation.

Digital Logic & Computer Architecture: number systems, boolean algebra, Karnaugh maps, combinational/sequential circuits, flip-flops, registers, ALU design, instruction set architecture (RISC vs CISC), datapath & control, pipelining (hazards, forwarding), branch prediction, cache hierarchy, memory consistency, SIMD/GPU architectures.

Operating Systems: processes vs threads, context switching, CPU scheduling (FCFS, SJF, RR, multilevel), synchronisation (critical section, Peterson, mutex, semaphore, monitor), classical problems (producer-consumer, readers-writers, dining philosophers), deadlocks (banker’s algorithm), memory management (paging, segmentation, TLB, page replacement), virtual memory, demand paging, segmentation faults, file systems (FAT, inode-based, journaling), I/O hardware, DMA, interrupts, polling, RAID, virtualisation (hypervisors, containers).

Computer Networks: OSI & TCP/IP stack, circuit vs packet switching, error detection/correction (parity, CRC, Hamming), flow control (stop-and-wait, Go-Back-N, selective repeat), Ethernet, VLANs, IP addressing (CIDR, subnetting, NAT), IPv6, routing (distance-vector, link-state, OSPF, BGP), ARP, DHCP, ICMP, transport layer (UDP, TCP 3-way handshake, congestion control: AIMD, slow-start, fast retransmit/recovery), socket programming, DNS, HTTP/1.1, HTTP/2, HTTPS (TLS handshake), SMTP, POP, IMAP, FTP, SNMP, quality of service (IntServ, DiffServ), software-defined networking (OpenFlow), network security (firewalls, IDS/IPS, VPN).

Database Systems: relational model, keys (candidate, primary, foreign), normal forms (1NF–5NF, BCNF), functional dependencies, decomposition, SQL (DDL, DML, TCL), joins (nested-loop, sort-merge, hash), indexing (B+ tree, hash, bitmap), query optimisation (cost model, selectivity, histograms), transactions (ACID), schedules, serialisability, 2PL, MVCC, deadlock detection/recovery, ARIES recovery algorithm, distributed databases (2PC, CAP, PACELC), NoSQL (key-value, document, column-family, graph), eventual consistency, MapReduce, Spark, data warehousing, OLAP, ETL.

Theory of Computation: alphabets, strings, languages, finite automata (DFA, NFA), epsilon-NFA, regular expressions, pumping lemma for regular languages, context-free grammars, push-down automata, pumping lemma for CFLs, Turing machines (decidable vs recognisable), Church-Turing thesis, decidability (halting problem), reducibility, complexity classes (P, NP, co-NP, NP-complete, NP-hard, PSPACE, L, NL).

Compiler Design: lexical analysis (finite automata, flex), parsing (LL, LR, SLR, LALR, recursive descent), syntax-directed translation, abstract syntax tree, symbol tables, type checking, run-time environments (activation records, static vs dynamic links), intermediate representations (3-address code, SSA), code generation (instruction selection, register allocation by graph colouring), optimisation (constant folding, dead-code elimination, loop optimisations, peephole), garbage collection (mark-sweep, copying, generational, reference counting).

Software Engineering: SDLC models (waterfall, incremental, spiral, agile), requirement engineering (user stories, use-cases, SRS), UML (class, sequence, state, activity diagrams), design principles (high cohesion, low coupling), architectural styles (layered, microservices, event-driven), test levels (unit, integration, system, acceptance), test design (equivalence partitioning, boundary value, decision table, state-based), TDD, CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, Jenkins), code reviews, static analysis, refactoring, DevOps culture, release strategies (blue-green, canary), logging, monitoring, SLI/SLO/SLA.

Formal Methods & Verification: propositional & temporal logic (LTL, CTL), model checking (spin, nuSMV), Hoare logic, pre/post conditions, loop invariants, weakest preconditions, SMT solvers (Z3), symbolic execution, property-based testing (QuickCheck).

Distributed Systems: clock synchronisation (NTP, Lamport timestamps, vector clocks), global state predicates, consensus (FLP result, Paxos, Raft, PBFT), Byzantine agreement, leader election, mutual exclusion (Maekawa), quorum systems, CAP theorem, availability patterns (master-slave, multi-master), partitioning strategies (hash, range, consistent hashing), replication (primary-backup, multi-leader, leaderless), gossip protocols, distributed file systems (GFS, HDFS), distributed hash tables (Chord, Kademlia), MapReduce, Spark, stream processing (Flink, Storm), microservice patterns (circuit breaker, saga, bulkhead), service discovery, eventual consistency, CRDTs, serverless (FaaS).

Computer Security: symmetric cryptography (AES modes, DES, 3DES), asymmetric cryptography (RSA, ElGamal, ECC), key exchange (Diffie-Hellman, ECDH), digital signatures (RSA, DSA, ECDSA), PKI & certificates (X.509, CA, chain of trust), TLS 1.3 handshake, hashing (MD5, SHA-1/2/3, HMAC), password storage (salt, pepper, bcrypt, scrypt, Argon2), authentication protocols (Kerberos, OAuth 2.0, OpenID Connect, SAML), access control (DAC, MAC, RBAC, ABAC), common vulnerabilities (buffer overflow, SQLi, XSS, CSRF, XXE, RCE, directory traversal), OWASP top 10, secure coding practices, penetration testing methodology, intrusion detection systems (signature vs anomaly), firewalls (packet-filter, stateful, application-layer), VPNs (IPsec, OpenVPN, WireGuard), blockchain consensus (PoW, PoS), smart-contract security, side-channel attacks (timing, power), differential privacy, homomorphic encryption, zero-knowledge proofs.

Human–Computer Interaction: usability heuristics (Nielsen), personas, scenarios, user-journey maps, low/high-fidelity prototyping, cognitive models (GOMS, Fitts’ law), accessibility (WCAG), evaluation methods (A/B testing, usability testing, heuristic evaluation), visual design principles, responsive design, mobile-first, material design.

Artificial Intelligence: search (uninformed: BFS, DFS, UCS; informed: greedy best-first, A*, IDA*), adversarial search (minimax, alpha-beta, Monte-Carlo tree search), constraint satisfaction (backtracking, arc-consistency, forward checking), knowledge representation (propositional & first-order logic, forward/backward chaining, resolution), ontologies, semantic web, rule-based systems, planning (STRIPS, partial-order, GraphPlan), probabilistic reasoning (Bayesian networks, d-separation, variable elimination), utility theory, decision networks, Markov decision processes (value/policy iteration, Q-learning, SARSA, deep Q-networks), temporal difference learning, policy gradients, actor-critic, multi-agent systems, game theory (Nash equilibrium), swarm intelligence, genetic algorithms, simulated annealing.

Machine Learning: linear regression (closed-form, gradient descent), logistic regression, softmax regression, regularisation (L1, L2, elastic-net), feature scaling/selection, bias-variance decomposition, generative vs discriminative, naive Bayes, Gaussian discriminant analysis, support vector machines (hinge loss, kernel trick, SMO), decision trees (ID3, C4.5, CART), ensemble methods (bagging, random forest, boosting: AdaBoost, Gradient Boosting, XGBoost), k-nearest neighbours, k-means clustering, hierarchical clustering, DBSCAN, Gaussian mixture models, EM algorithm, dimensionality reduction (PCA, LDA, t-SNE, autoencoders), anomaly detection, recommender systems (collaborative filtering, matrix factorisation, deep learning), evaluation metrics (ROC, AUC, precision-recall, F1, log-loss, confusion matrix), cross-validation, hyper-parameter tuning (grid, random, Bayesian optimisation), pipelines, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX.

Deep Learning: multilayer perceptron, activation functions (ReLU, Leaky-ReLU, GELU), weight initialisation (Xavier, He), optimisers (SGD, Momentum, AdaGrad, RMSProp, Adam, AdamW), learning-rate schedules, batch normalisation, layer normalisation, dropout, data augmentation, convolutional neural networks (filters, stride, padding, dilated/atrous, grouped, depthwise-separable), classic architectures (LeNet, AlexNet, VGG, GoogLeNet, ResNet, DenseNet), transfer learning, object detection (R-CNN family, SSD, YOLO), semantic segmentation (FCN, U-Net, DeepLab), recurrent neural networks (Elman, Jordan, LSTM, GRU), bidirectional RNNs, encoder-decoder, attention mechanism (Bahdanau, Luong), Transformer (self-attention, positional encoding, multi-head), BERT (MLM, NSP), GPT (autoregressive), T5, vision transformer (ViT), generative models (VAE, GAN: generator, discriminator, WGAN, StyleGAN), diffusion models, self-supervised learning, few-shot learning, meta-learning, neural architecture search, pruning, quantisation, knowledge distillation, explainability (Grad-CAM, LIME, SHAP).

Natural Language Processing: text pre-processing (tokenisation, normalisation, stemming, lemmatisation, sentence segmentation), n-gram language models, smoothing (Laplace, Good-Turing, Kneser-Ney), neural language models (Word2Vec: CBOW/SG, GloVe, FastText), contextual embeddings (ELMo, BERT, RoBERTa), part-of-speech tagging, named-entity recognition (IOB tagging), dependency parsing, constituency parsing, semantic role labelling, word-sense disambiguation, coreference resolution, sentiment analysis, topic modelling (LDA, NMF), text classification, spam detection, machine translation (seq2seq, attention, Transformer), BLEU score, summarisation (extractive vs abstractive), question answering (reading comprehension, open-domain), dialogue systems (retrieval vs generative), information retrieval (TF-IDF, BM25, vector-space model), inverted index, PageRank, question classification (TREC taxonomy), speech-to-text (HMM, CTC, wav2vec), text-to-speech, low-resource NLP, multilingual models, ethics (bias, fairness, toxicity detection).

Computer Vision: image formation (pin-hole camera, lens distortion), colour spaces (RGB, HSV, LAB), interpolation (nearest, bilinear, bicubic), filtering (Gaussian, box, median), edge detection (Sobel, Prewitt, Canny, Laplacian), corner detection (Harris, FAST), blobs (LoG, DoG), histograms (equalisation, back-projection), morphological operations (erosion, dilation, opening, closing), contours, distance transform, template matching, Hough transform, camera calibration (Zhang’s method), stereo vision (disparity map, depth estimation), epipolar geometry, optical flow (Lucas-Kanade, Horn-Schunck), tracking (Kalman, mean-shift, CAMShift), background subtraction, Viola-Jones face detector, HOG + SVM, deep CNN features, YOLO, SSD, Mask R-CNN, single-image super-resolution, style transfer, image captioning, visual question answering, 3-D vision (point clouds, ICP, SLAM), augmented reality, medical image analysis, ethics (deep-fake detection, privacy).

Cloud Computing: virtualisation (hypervisors, KVM, Xen, VMware), containers (cgroups, namespaces, Docker, containerd), orchestration (Kubernetes: pods, deployments, services, ingress, config-maps, secrets, stateful sets, daemon sets, CRDs), serverless (Lambda, Azure Functions, Knative), auto-scaling (horizontal/vertical, predictive), load balancing (round-robin, least-connections, IP-hash), service mesh (Istio, Linkerd), micro-services patterns (API gateway, circuit breaker, saga), infrastructure as code (Terraform, CloudFormation), configuration management (Ansible, Puppet, Chef), monitoring (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, Jaeger, OpenTelemetry), SLI/SLO/SLA, disaster recovery, backup strategies, multi-cloud, edge computing, federated learning, green computing.

Parallel & High-Performance Computing: Amdahl’s & Gustafson’s laws, Flynn’s taxonomy (SISD, SIMD, MISD, MIMD), shared-memory vs distributed-memory, UMA vs NUMA, cache coherence (MESI), memory consistency models, OpenMP, pthreads, MPI, CUDA, OpenCL, SIMD intrinsics (AVX, SSE), vectorisation, loop tiling, loop unrolling, prefetching, branch prediction, GPU architecture (warps, occupancy, shared memory), reduction algorithms, scan algorithms, parallel sorting (bitonic, sample-sort), MapReduce, BSP model, task scheduling (work-stealing), performance profiling (perf, VTune), roofline model, energy efficiency.

Quantum Computing: qubit, Bloch sphere, superposition, entanglement, measurement, quantum gates (Pauli, Hadamard, CNOT, Toffoli), universal gate sets, Bell states, no-cloning theorem, quantum circuits, Deutsch-Jozsa algorithm, Shor’s factoring algorithm, Grover’s search algorithm, quantum error correction (Shor code, Steane code), fault tolerance, physical vs logical qubits, NISQ devices, quantum supremacy, quantum key distribution (BB84), post-quantum cryptography.

Ethics, Law & Professional Practice: ACM/IEEE code of ethics, intellectual property (copyright, patents, trade secrets), licensing (GPL, MIT, Apache), GDPR, CCPA, data protection impact assessment, algorithmic bias, fairness definitions (individual vs group), explainable AI, right to explanation, sustainability & carbon footprint of IT, accessibility standards (WCAG), whistle-blowing, conflict of interest, responsible disclosure.
